status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"84t25","text":"Prepare fresh daily 120 U/mL α-amylase  (Bacillus licheniformis) in MOPS buffer. 1 mL per sample will be needed. Initial concentration of α-amylase is 3000 U/mL.  Use C1V1 = C2V2 to calculate the volume of α-amylase and MOPS buffer to use.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":168,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":170,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":175,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":177,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ans9q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"upo9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eg413","text":"α-amylase comes at 3000 U/mL concentration in a 20 mL bottle. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5hv5s","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f5qg6","text":"To prepare 250 mL of 120 U/mL α-amylase in MOPS buffer, dilute 10 mL α-amylase (3000 U/mL) into 240 mL MOPS buffer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"616a2","text":"Prepare fresh daily 30 U/mL amyloglucosidase (Aspergillus niger) in acetate buffer. 1 mL per sample will be needed. Initial concentration of amyloglucosidase is 3260 U/mL.  Use C1V1 = C2V2 to calculate the volume of amyloglucosidase  and acetate buffer to use.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":178,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":180,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":185,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":187,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r3cf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cg3hk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aph5r","text":"To prepare 250 mL of 30 U/mL amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer, dilute 2.3 mL amyloclucosidase (3260 U/mL) into 247.7 mL acetate buffer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dllpr","text":"Add   of α-amylase in MOPS buffer (120 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"cpn0k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"62BEDE30634211ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":"94052","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bga0","text":"Vortex to suspend all solids.  Flicking the tube may help dislodge the dried starch pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bv05","text":"Add another   of α-amylase in MOPS buffer (120 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"CD7440F3634211ECA03C0A58A9FEAC02","id":"94053","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34idt","text":"Cool down the water bath to  , tubes can be stored at room temp on the counter while water bath cools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2ccpc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"juh2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F8B8E160634211ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":"51914","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"50","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"afa5p","text":"Leaving the lid off, especially if it is a shaking water bath, will help cool.  For faster cooling, remove some water from the water bath and refill with cool distilled water.  Do not use tap water as mineral buildup or heated chlorine could damage the water bath. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fuir","text":"Add   amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer (30 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"55o5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"1F063830634411ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":"94054","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"449rd","text":"Add another   amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer (30 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6pd11","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"2518A1E0634411ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":"94055","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6ubk","text":"Place the tubes in ice to stop the reaction, until cool to the touch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ak6g","text":"Proceed to total starch (as glucose) quantification by NZYtech GOD-POD method or store the samples at -20°C up to one month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Total Starch Enzymatic Digestion
